awd_titl_txt: CC*IIE IAM: Secure Access for Everyone (SAFE)
awd_abstract_narration:
Multi-institutional distributed scientific research collaborations involving the sharing of resources are challenging and fraught with a lot of effort in obtaining and managing multiple identities. Secure Access for Everyone (SAFE) creates an Identity and Access Management (IAM) infrastructure that facilitates easy access to campus Cyberinfrastructure (CI) resources for local, state, regional and national researchers. SAFE will achieve this by implementing the following three-part strategy: (1) Integrating CI resources with opensource IAM software; (2) Facilitating collaboration and coordination of multi-institutional resources; and (3) Leveraging custom gateways using InCommon for federated access. The gateways to these resources are enhanced to include multiple access methods, including web and command line and integrate the use of HPC schedulers and access from the Open Science Grid. The SAFE architecture initially provides federated access to library databases, High Performance Computing resources, Virtual Computing Lab (a cloud based compute reservation environment), and the Sunshine State Educational and Research Computing Alliance?s (SSERCA) collaborative storage ecosystem. CI resources such as these perform a key role in supporting scientific collaborations across campuses, regional, national, international and virtual organizations, and spanning scientific communities. These multi-institutional science research collaborations involving the sharing of resources are challenging and fraught with a lot of effort in obtaining and managing multiple identities. SAFE solves this by allowing researchers to login to CI resources with their local institutions credentials for trusted access. 

Secure Access for Everyone (SAFE) is a well coordinated usable federated identity and access management system that leverages and enhances campus CI in order to support trusted collaboration and sharing of compute and data resources that is now essential to facilitate multi-institutional scientific research collaborations.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

por.por_cntn:
Secure Access For Everyone (SAFE), award #ACI-1440728, has built a standards-based integrated Identity and Access Management (IAM) system that supports trusted collaboration and sharing of CI resources across multiple institutions.  The main goal of the SAFE project was to facilitate multi-institutional distributed scientific collaborations.  

Intellectual Merit: SAFE transformed the process for multi-institutional distributed research collaborations at FIU. External collaborators/researchers no longer have to go through a manual and lengthy account request process, nor do they have to remember a separate username and password. Instead, external collaborators are now able to authenticate using credentials from their home institution. Upon successful authentication through the SAFE web portable, the external collaborator is given to access to requested FIU CI resources using a single user interface – the Web Portal. This enables the growth of the variety collaborative research and easy access to FIU research data.

Broader Impacts: SAFE enhanced collaboration and coordination of multi-institutional resources by integrating FIU’s Collaborative Data Storage with that of SSERCA’s - allowing users from around the state to store and share data for joint research projects. Additionally, through the creation of the SAFE portal, researchers from multiple institutions can now easily request and gain access to FIU’s CI resources quickly and using their home institutions credentials.

Library Databases are a collection of various external subscription based resources and internal library resources that provide access to reference and research materials. Not all of these resources support the same authentication methods. FIU faculty and students need access to these resources for research and reference purposes, in order to seamlessly access electronic library resources that provide research and reference materials. Some of the Library resources are using external authentication providers or locally stored credentials that require FIU users to remember another user name and password. SAFE integrated each library resource with one of the identity providers in the SAFE architecture. 

The succesful implementation of SAFE has led to easier access to FIU CI resources for FIU faculty, students and their external collaborators. 


Last Modified: 12/01/2016
Modified by: Julio Ibarra
